title-group.article-title: The Adjustment of Employment to Technical Change in the Steel and Auto Industries

abstract.p: Technical change has two separate effects on labor demand. On the one hand, new machinery can displace workers. On the other hand, the change may result in lower output prices, which in turn may lead to higher production and, hence, may require more workers. In this paper we estimate the effects of these opposing factors on labor demand in the auto and steel industries between 1959 and 1980.
